newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends slightly firmer vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends slightly firmer vs dollar.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka closed marginally firmer at 43.7485/7495 to the dollar in interbank trading on Saturday against the previous 43.7495/7500, dealers said.
The local unit was quoted stronger and in a wide range at 43.7400/7495 per dollar in early trade.
Dealers said the session had been dull, mainly because of the weekend closure of international markets.

The interbank call money rates closed nine to 10 percent against previous close at 6.5 to 7.5 percent. Dealers said call rates had gone up following payments of 1.7 billion taka by some banks against purchase of central bank treasury bills.
